thread.title: 23-year-old man kills teenager for forced unnnatural sex
thread.title_full: 23-year-old man kills teenager for forced unnnatural sex

author: Wires English | Press Trust of India
title: 23-year-old man kills teenager for forced unnnatural sex
text:
Comments Bundi (Raj), Oct 21 : A 19-year-old boy was killed allegedly by a man after the teenager “forced” him to engage in a homosexual act, police said. The body of the boy was found on September 19, a day after his murder in Hindoli area here. The accused, identified as Zakir Mohammed, 23, a resident of Mahaveernagar Colony here, has been arrested in connection with the murder of Lokendra Singh Yadav, a resident of Ban Ka Kheda village, Superintendent of Police Bhuvan Bhushan Yadav told reporters here last evening. Zakir has confessed to the murder act, he said. During the interrogation, the accused told police that the Lokendra was a “homosexual” and “forcing him to engage in unnatural sexual relationship with him,” police said. Zakir, who works at a barber’s shop, was allegedly being pressurized by Yadav, a high-school dropout, for unnatural sex and he used to bully him for money, the SP said. On the fateful night of September 18, Yadav and Zakir both consumed liquor at a spot along the Kota-Jaipur highway after which Lokendra started forcing him for physical relationship, and unable to bear the pressure any more, Zakir strangled him to death, he said. (Also Read: Bomb explodes near Manipur MLA’s house) Following the incident, Zakir threw the clothes, bag, ID and other belongings of Lokendra into Jait Sagar lake, he said, adding, the bag and the belongings were later recovered from the lake. The accused has been arrested and booked under section 302 (murder) and 201 (causing disappearance of evidence) of the IPC and further interrogation is going on, police said. Meanwhile, Lokendra’s family members have rejected the reason being given behind the motive of the murder by the police.
